org.vadere.util.math

Class MathUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.vadere.util.math.MathUtil

  • public class MathUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Math utilities not covered by java.lang.Math

    • Method Detail

      • norm2

        public static double norm2(double[] vector)
        The two-norm of a vector.
        Parameters:
        vector - a double vector with arbitrary number of entries x1,x2,....
        Returns:
        sqrt(x1^2+x2^2+...)

      • norm1

        public static double norm1(double[] vector)
        The one-norm of a vector.
        Parameters:
        vector - a double vector with arbitrary number of entries x1,x2,....
        Returns:
        abs(x1)+abs(x2)+...

      • cutExpGrad2D

        public static void cutExpGrad2D(double[] x,
                                double cut,
                                double[] grad)
        The value of the gradient of the 2D smooth function with compact support given by exp(1/((x/cut)^2-1)).
        Parameters:
        x - 2D position where the gradient should be evaluated.
        cut - if abs(x)>cut, the function (and its gradient) is zero.
        grad - a 2D vector where the result is stored.

      • cutExp

        public static double cutExp(double x,
                            double cut)
        The value of the 2D smooth function with compact support given by exp(1/((x/cut)^2-1)).
        Parameters:
        x - 2D position where the gradient should be evaluated.
        cut - if abs(x)>cut, the function is zero.

      • cutExp

        public static double cutExp(double x,
                            double cut,
                            double p)
        The value of the 2D smooth function with compact support given by exp(1/((x/cut)^(2p)-1)).
        Parameters:
        x - 2D position where the gradient should be evaluated.
        cut - if abs(x)>cut, the function is zero.

      • vecAdd

        public static void vecAdd(double[] vec,
                          double[] vecToAdd)
        Adds a vector to another one.
        Parameters:
        vec - the initial vector that contains the solution later on.
        vecToAdd - the vector that should be added.

      • mult

        public static void mult(double[] vec,
                        double scalar)
        Multiplies the given vector with a scalar.

      • smallestViewingAngle

        public static double smallestViewingAngle(double[] x,
                                          double[] v,
                                          double[] x2)
        computes the "smallest distance on the circle" of the angle (x+v,x,x2-x)
        Parameters:
        x - the starting position
        v - the viewing direction
        x2 - the position that should be evaluated
        Returns:
        a value between 0.0 and 1.0 that indicates how much of the position is visible. 1.0 is fully visible, 0.0 is hidden.

      • visiblePortion

        public static double visiblePortion(double[] x,
                                    double[] v,
                                    double[] x2)
        Computes the portion of a position x2 that is visible from position x given the direction in v.
        Parameters:
        x - the starting position
        v - the viewing direction
        x2 - the position that should be evaluated
        Returns:
        a value between 0.0 and 1.0 that indicates how much of the position is visible. 1.0 is fully visible, 0.0 is hidden.

      • step

        public static double step(double t,
                          double sigma)
        A smooth "step" function with given sigma.
        Parameters:
        t - the value where the function should be evaluated
        sigma - the sigma for smoothing the step
        Returns:
        step(t)

      • normalize

        public static void normalize(double[] vec)
        If the vector is nonzero, sets it to the same direction with length = 1.

      • quasiRandom2D

        public static double[][] quasiRandom2D(java.util.Random rndSource,
                                       int count,
                                       double width,
                                       double height,
                                       double randomFrac)
        Generates quasi random numbers in two dimensions using a VERY simple algorithm.
        Parameters:
        rndSource - the random number source that is used in the algorithm.
        count - number of points in two dimensions that should be created
        width - width of the area where the points should be created
        height - height of the area where the points should be created
        randomFrac - 0...1, specifies the amount that is added after the bin is chosen
        Returns:
        an array with dimension [count][2]

      • cross

        public static void cross(double[] v1,
                         double[] v2,
                         double[] cross)
        Computes the cross product of two vectors and store it in the cross vector.
        Parameters:
        v1 - vector 1
        v2 - vector 2
        cross - 3D vector that will contain the result: cross = (v1 x v2)

      • getMooreNeighborhood

        public static java.util.List<java.awt.Point> getMooreNeighborhood(java.awt.Point p)
        Returns a list of absolute coordinates which correspond to the Moore neighborhood of the given point p.

      • toDouble

        public static double[] toDouble(org.apache.commons.math3.complex.Complex[] complex)
        Transforms an array of Complex numbers to a double array of doubled length. At even indicies there are the real parts and at odd indicies are the imaginary parts of the complex numbers.
        Parameters:
        complex - a array of Complex numbers
        Returns:
        a double array representing the same complex numbers

      • toFloat

        public static float[] toFloat(org.apache.commons.math3.complex.Complex[] complex)
        Transforms an array of Complex numbers to a float array of doubled length. At even indicies there are the real parts and at odd indicies are the imaginary parts of the complex numbers.
        Parameters:
        complex - a array of Complex numbers
        Returns:
        a float array representing the same complex numbers

      • toComplex

        public static org.apache.commons.math3.complex.Complex[] toComplex(double[] realValues)
        Transform the real numbers to complex numbers i.e. the imaginary part is zero.
        Returns:
        a complex array representing the same real numbers
